description.narrative: By 2022, the Government and Parliament stakeholders have increased capacity to formulate equitable child-friendly policies,which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance (Covid), Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, evidence-driven, integrated and equitable social protection policies, efficient financial allocations and family-friendly local service provision are in place to address the social exclusion of children in Ukraine

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Integrated Office 1 Klovskiy Uzviz 01021 Kiev

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)

description.narrative: Building on the results of 2018, UNICEF in Ukraine has continued an active engagement in the areas of integrated social protection, implementation of baby box programme; coordination through inter-ministerial group on child rights as well as expanded the scope of the output to the areas of universal child grant and child poverty analysis. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/01/2020
